Usage¶

This section probably has the most to change and develop, currently the sim is not user friendly and lacks any user interface. This will be added soonTM!

Classes¶

class heuristics.Buses.Buses(id, start_stop, bus_capacity, speed, running_cost, current_stop)¶

Bases: object

Class containing the details of buses. This contains the tools needed to create bus agents within the simulator as well as defining the action sets that they can take.

Intended use: If you are making changes to this then you are changing what data relating to the bus agent and/or changing the action sets of the bus agents.

TODO Action sets : Move stop, wait(n), pickPass, dropPass

Parameters:

  • id (int) – ID of the bus

  • start_stop (Stop) – The stop the bus begins its journey at

  • bus_capacity (int) – Maximum passenger capacity

  • speed (int) – Speed the bus travels

  • running_cost (int) – The cost of moving the bus a single unit

  • current_stop (Stop) – The current stop the bus is at

TODO Include ownership and accessibility

get_start_stop_id()¶

Returns the id of the starting stop :return: Returns the stop ID of the buses starting stop :rtype: int

class heuristics.Jobs.Jobs(weight, arrival_date, type)¶

Bases: object

Jobs act as a dataset containing information on weight, arrival time and type

Intended usage: If you are making changes here you are modifying the data that a job (A section of a route) has

Parameters:

  • weight (int) – Current carry weight

  • arrival_date (date) – Date of arrival

  • type (str) – Type of job

This is the class that handles the outputs of the system. This includes the logs (i.e a dense record of the runs) and the generation of graphs and images.

Intended usage: If you are making changes here you are changing the outputs that are calculated from the output data of the world enviornemnt.

class heuristics.Passenger.Passenger(id, xcord, ycord, destination_x, destination_y, capacity_cost, walk_cost, speed, pickup_time, dropoff_time, booked, lateness)¶

Bases: object

Passenger class

This class contains paramiters and action sets of the passenger agent.

Intended Usage: If you are making changes here you are changing either the data pertaining to the passenger agent or their action set.

TODO Action sets

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Passenger Id

  • xcord (int) – Passenger Coordinate on the X axis

  • ycord (int) – Passenger Coordinate on the Y axis

  • destination_x (int) – Coordinates of the passenger destination on the X axis

  • destination_y (int) – Coordinates of the passenger destination on the Y axis

  • capacity_cost (int) – Passenger capacity cost, standard passenger is 1 wheelchair is 4 ect

  • walk_cost (int) – The cost to have the passenger move 1 unit [Note, currently an arbitrary value]

  • speed (int) – Rate at witch the passengers move

  • pickup_time (int) – Target pickup time

  • dropoff_time – Target time the passenger wants to get to their destination

  • booked (bool) – If the passenger has booked in advance

  • lateness (int) – How much overall time the passenger will allow for lateness

class heuristics.Route.Route(stop, arrival_time, wait_time, passenger_manifest)¶

Bases: object

Class contains information for a section of the route, contains the information about passengers and timing info

Intended usage: If you are making changes here then you are modifying the data that contains a route

Parameters:

  • stop (Stop) – The stop that is relevant to the route section

  • arrival_time (int) – The time the vehicle arrives at the stop

  • wait_time (int) – The time the vehicle is waiting at the stop

  • passenger_manifest (List of <Passengers>) – List of passengers on vehicle at the stop

class heuristics.Stops.Stop(id, name, lat, long, local_ref, network, operator, shelter, bench, tactile_paving, wheelchair, departure_board, lit, bins, covered, passenger_information_display, pole, flag, kerb, traffic_sign, advertising, layer, street, crossing, look_up_index)¶

Bases: object

A class that handles the parameters of the stops, generally all these parameters are taken from the parameters that are taken from the XML flags in the Open Street Map data. These flags make this class very cumbersome. However, these details will be integral to integrating the accessibility into the system. Additionally many of these flags are null in the OSM data, this is an issue with the data source and future data collection will cover these flags.

Intended usage: If you are making changes here then you are changing the way the imported stop data is processed

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Stop id

  • name (str) – The name of the bus stop or street

  • lat (Float) – Latitude coordinate

  • long (Float) – Longitude coordinate

  • local_ref (str) – Unofficial name

  • network (str) – Bus network stop belongs too

  • operator (str) – Who operates the stop

  • shelter (bool) – Is there a bus shelter present

  • bench (bool) – Is there a bench present

  • tactile_paving (bool) – Is tactile paving present

  • wheelchair (bool) – Is the stop wheelchair accessible

  • departure_board (bool) – Is there are live departure board at the stop

  • lit (bool) – Are there streetlights present

  • bins (bool) – Are there bins at the stop

  • covered (bool) – Is there a cover from rain at the stop

  • passenger_information_display (bool) – Is there a dynamic information board present

  • pole (bool) – Is there a pole with bus information

  • flag (bool) – Is there a stop flag present

  • kerb (bool) – Is there a dropped kerb at the stop

  • traffic_sign (bool) – Is there a traffic sign at the stop

  • advertising (bool) – Is there an advertisement at the stop

  • layer (int) – The height layer the stop is on

  • street (str) – The street name

  • crossing (str) – The name of the nearest crossing

  • look_up_index (int) – The stops position in the lookup table

calcDistance(x1, y1, x2, y2)¶

class heuristics.Controller.Controller(no_buses, no_passengers, max_bus_cap, max_lateness, sim_runs)¶

Bases: object

This Class acts as the overall manager for the simulator, taking user input and data files and serving them to the correct heuristic solver as well as managing the world enviornment inputs. The overall aim is to create a flexible framework that manages the janker parts of the sim.

Intended use: In general if you are tweaking this you are aiming to change what data is being served to various parts of the sim, not changing how that data is generated.

Parameters:

  • no_buses (int) – How many bus agents are used in the simulator

  • no_passengers (int) – How many passenger agents are used in the simulator

  • max_bus_cap (int) – The maximum amount of passengers a bus can hold

  • max_lateness (int) – The maximum time a passenger will allow the bus to be late before canceling

  • sim_runs (int) – How many runs of the sim will be run

generate_booking_times(passengers, preeminence_percent, preebook_percent)¶

Generator for the the booking time paramiter. By passing the population (or a sample) of passengers it will set a percentage (set by passenger_preeminence_precent) of the passengers to be random passengers where their pickup time is the same as their booking time, or passengers who have prebooked and ie their pickup time exists after their booking time.

Parameters:

  • passengers (List<passengers>) – The population of passengers that you want to set as booked/nonbooked

  • preeminence_percent (int) – The percentage of passengers who have prebooked

  • preebook_percent (float) – The maximum percantage of pickup time in advance that the passenger booked

Returns:

passengers

Return type:

List<Passengers>

generate_buses()¶

Generate the parameters and list of the bus agents.

generate_depo(stops)¶

Randomly selects a stop from the provided list of stops to be the designated depo

generate_passenger()¶

Generate the parameters and list of passenger agents

import_stop_data()¶

Runs the stop importer to extract the stop data from the CSV to the self.list_of_stops

import_stop_relations_data()¶

Extracts the relationship data between stops (read time between) from the ProjectOSM generated file into an array. This array is implicitly indexed by the X Y position in the array corresponding to the stop in the same position in self.list_of_stops

inc_both_seeds()¶

Increment both sim and hur seeds

inc_heur_seed()¶

Increment Heuristic seed

inc_sim_seed()¶

Increment Simulator seed

inti_all_gen(passengers)¶

This will initialize and run all the generators needed to initialize the world settings

Event class hold the information used for an event including, start action, end action, relevent agents, position, and timing

Intended usage: If you are making changes here you are modifying the events and what they contain not how they are handled

param start_or_end:

If the event is the start or the end of an action

type start_or_end:

bool

param relevant_agents:

What agents are affected by the event

type relevant_agents:

Agent TODO Same problem here need to better define agent

type position_x:

float

param position_y:

Position of the event in the Y axis

type position_y:

float

remove_possible_actions(actions)¶
abstract set_possible_actions()¶

Dependencies, ok this one is important and im not 100% on the implementaion so im going to slap some code down and think about the arcitecture

Dependencies have a big role to play in the research this simulator is designed to do atm. For every dependancy each passenger has a weight assigned to how much they care about dependancies
